note.p: Education: Westminster School; New College, Oxford. BA (1787); MA (1791); BD and DD (1805)

Career: Tutor to the Prince of Orange (William II of Holland) whilst in Oxford; Canon of Christ Church, Oxford (1804); Reguis Professor of Divinity, Oxford University (1809); Privy Councillor; Bishop of London (1813-1828); Archbishop of Canterbury (1828-1848); opposed Catholic Emancipation (1829), Parliamentary reform (1831) and Jewish relief (1833)
References: W H Brock, 'The Selection of the Authors of the Bridgewater Treatises' in NR 1966 vol 21 pp 162-179
